Name: Encontro Marcado
Description: Each player must avoid the other player on a labyrinth. Every time you make your move, you influence the other player decision for the next move. The one that reaches the center first is the winner.

Name: Pavia 1525
Description: The battles of Pavia: France against Spain for the control of Italy.

Name: Magikon
Description:
Magikon is a simple Role Playing Game published in Italian + French only by International Team in 1984. 
The guide to encounters includes 22 different kind of people with illustrations made by Mauro Moretti.
The background: Every 1000 years, the shadow master organizes a competition between magician-knights to chose who will succeed to him as governor of the Magikon castle and the surrounding region.
The players will explore the roads around the castle to find monsters, traps and villages. Every player has the same kind of background, so the team working is not necessary and usually, each player explores different areas.

Name: The Space Game
Description:
A game of interstellar trade and conquest. Players explore new worlds, make deals with resources, build fleets and do battle with their fleets, with agents or on the market.  Each turn you may: 
1.Place a piece 
2.Move your ships and/or place agents
3.Bribe stars (to conquer them), battle over stars or build ships.
The object of the game is to be the last surviving player or the player with the most stars and resources wins.

Name: Dicefest
Description:
Dicefest is a strategic, abstract board game for two, three or four players who must manipulate their dice and get them to the other side of the board to win. Players will need to think and plan ahead to gain ground. Knowing how to maneuver the dice efficiently while blocking your opponents’ moves are important elements to winning.

Dicefest is available here;
http://www.geocities.com/roujin27/dicefest.html

Name: Puzzle Train
Description:
Puzzle Train

Puzzle Train is a boardgame 'German type' (puzzle slide-game) for 4 players design by José Carlos de Diego Guerrero, based in Puzzle Railroad pc-game by XD Games and it is a crossover of Mississippi Queen and Carcassonne.

This game was published in the magazine Tabula #6 (in Spanish).

Links:

Review in Revista Tabula #6 (in Spanish)
http://www.labsk.net/index.php?topic=127.0

Download (in Spanish, previous register)
http://www.labsk.net/index.php?topic=143.0

Name: Operation Warboard
Description: An entry level tabletop wargame, that in fact has a greater level of detail than most "beginner" rule sets. Taking the approach of low cost gaming, the pictures and diagrams all depict ways to cut costs and begin gaming, and as such tends to relegate this rule set to a "beginner" level. Set as a platoon or company level engagement, the rules have a unique MG grid to infantry fire resolution. A good example of "low detail" for those that are "painting" impaired.

Name: All For One
Description:
France, 1630. The Royal Musketeers are personal guards of King Louis XIII, defending the King against the dubious plots of Cardinal Richelieu. Athos, Porthos, Aramis, d'Artagnan, Rochefort, and MiLady DiWinter move around Paris, fighting duels and completing missions to earn the favor of the King and Cardinal. Both characters and players earn Favors throughout the game and bonus points are scored at the end when players reveal their true allegiances. The winner is the player who's earned the most Favor!

All For One is a pickup/deliver game for 3-5 players. Players are not tied to any specific character, rather each turn you choose which character to activate and then take actions with that character. Each player is secretly assigned one of the characters whose score will be added to their own at the end of the game. Your 'secret identity' helps drive decisions during the game, but in order to win you'll have to utilize all of the characters.

The board is an interconnected web of streets, some of which are patrolled by Cardinal's Guards. The guards serve to hinder the musketeers' progress. There are 6 named locations where the characters begin the game, and the other 18 locations are home to 1 plot token each. 2 of the tokens are horses, which can be ridden by the characters. The rest are used to complete missions.

The missions are printed on Mission Cards, which detail which character must complete the mission, which Plot Tokens are necessary to complete the mission, and the location at which the mission must be completed. Completing these missions involves collecting various Plot Tokens from around the board, and bringing them to specific places. Some missions involve getting 2 of the characters to a specific place at the same time, and some missions involve a duel between two characters.

Name: Amnesia: The Short-Term Memory Game.
Description:
From the Publisher's Instructions Sheet:

Amnesia is a short-term memory game where you can score if you remember ... and score if you forget. To WIN, just start on START and make it around your triangle to the center of the board.

Name: Arcadia
Description:
A tile-laying and -stacking game, a basic set consists of 40 hexagonal tiles worth different numbers of points.  The tile are ridged so that three tiles together can form a base for a fourth tile to sit upon them.

Gameplay consists of playing tiles from a "hand" of three tiles.  Tiles laid on top of other tiles are required to have the same pattern inscribed on them as the tile making up their base.  Tiles placed above the first level score depending on the point value of the tile played and the level it was played on .

Sets come in a single color, and different sets come in different colors, allowing for expansion and more advanced play in which color also becomes a factor for scoring.

Name: Holding: The Financial Game of Chinese Boxes
Description:
The financial game of Chinese boxes.
The target of the game is to acquire the absolute majority (160)of the shares. You must go around the board collecting shares and creating new societies and holding companies. Four circuits around four countries give different risk features and you have to manage black funds, bankruptcy, transfers of capital, purchase of shares and the majority of companies. The movement on the board is made by dice rolling.

Note: it is  strongly suspected that this game is identical to Capital Power: The Financial Game of Chinese Boxes. But until someone can compare the two boxes and their contents, we should keep two entries in the database.

Name: Probaddility
Description: Probaddility is an engaging card game dealing with probability and simple addition. Players make educated bets about the likely numbers hidden under opponents cards and win or lose cards depending on the accuracy of their predictions. A fun and engaging introduction to these basic concepts.

Name: Real Numbers
Description: The REAL NUMBERS game was designed as a prelude to EQUATIONS. It comes in a handy 5-game kit that can be clipped to a pen in your shirt pocket. The REAL NUMBERS Game provides a practical introduction to the process of finding Solutions from randomly generated symbols similar to what occurs in EQUATIONS. The REAL NUMBERS Game deals with real, rational, irrational, integer, and natural numbers.

Name: Lady Oscar
Description: Children game based on the Italian version of a popular Japanese cartoon (The Rose of Versailles, called "Lady Oscar" in Italy).

Name: The Meditation Game
Description:
From Publisher:

THE MEDITATION GAME offers a delightful excursion into the realm of pure strategy. Though simple in design, the game is rich in creative possibilities and subtle surprises. The colorful playing mat and 49 playing rings are used by two players or teams in the pursuit of “Spontaneous Right Action”. Clear, coherent and comprehensive thought is required for success. THE MEDITATION GAME offers people of all ages a refreshing opportunity to experience a gentle, mental massage.

Name: UNO: Batman Begins
Description:
Based on the 2005 Batman Begins movie.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: the special Justice Card.

"When a Justice card is played, the player who plays it may deal out 'justice' to the other players in the form of his/her cards. Starting in the current direction of play, the player dealing 'justice' gives one card to each of the remianing players until he/she is down to one card. Upon dealing the next to last card the player of the Justice card must call 'UNO' or be subjected to the two-card penalty. This card also functions as a regular Wild card allowing the player who plays it to call out a new colour when he/she finishes dealing out his/her cards."
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Gazala-Tobruk
Description:
Gazala-Tobruk game system, of medium complexity, puts the emphasis on armored combat, with tank/armor units at battalion level and regiments and brigades for the infantry. Each type of unit exerts a type of ZoC depending of the quantity and/or quality of its anti tank/armor assets, from rigid ZoC to semi rigid or no ZoC at all.

Other outstanding aspects of the rules are the HQ units that give combat support (There are HQ at the Army, Corps, Division levels, and even at Brigade level for independent British Armored brigades); minefields, air support and Allied redoubts or boxes.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Mimikri
Description:
Mimikri can be played as two variants of traditional chess.

In the first, players know the identity their own pieces but not that of their opponent. Only by studying the opponent's moves, can the pieces be identified.

In the second variant, players know the identity of their opponent's pieces but not of their own. Moves are made blindly. If a player moves a piece inappropriately, the opposing player says "no," the piece is returned to its original position and it becomes the opposing player's turn to move. However, if the move is appropriate, the piece remains in its new position thus revealing its identity. Subsequent moves can be made accordingly. It is now the opposing player's turn to move.

The game was published by 3M exclusively for Germany.

Name: Civil War Wit
Description:
A simple trivia game covering the American Civil War.  Each card (two standard decks' worth) has a photograph or etching reproduction on the front and a point value.  On the back are two questions--one "buff" level, the other "scholar" level.  Get either question right--it's not clear, from the rules, who gets to choose which question gets asked, the asker or the answerer--and you get the points listed on the card.  There is often no clear connection between the point value of the question and its difficulty.  The pictures, however, are very nice.

In an odd twist, if a card's question goes unanswered, the answer is then read aloud and the card set aside.  After all the rest of the cards have been dealt with, this pile of discards--whose answers, again, have been revealed--gets shuffled up and gone through again.  Presumably this is to test short-term memory.  The game ends once all cards have been correctly answered.

This is part of a series of "WIT" games from this company, which included trivia games on wildlife, National Parks, and other Americana topics.

Name: Asesinato en el Orient Express
Description:
A murder has happened on the Orient Express train. There are 12 characters, the suspects. One player moves the characters around a map of Europe, and he is the only one to know the identity of the killer.
Each of the other players leads a team of 3 detectives around Europe, accomplishing missions that give them clues about the killer's identity, while the killer tries to mislead them.
The detective teams must cooperate, but remembering that only one player will be the winner. If the killer has not been discovered after the set time limit (between 1 and 2 hours), he wins.

Name: Word Fun
Description:
The rules for two different games are included in the box.

One, Two, Three - Go! (for 3-4 players)

Object of the Game
Each player competes with others to collect as many 3 card sets as quickly as possible.

Rules:
1. Place all cards scattered face up in the center of the group.
2. On a count of three, each player begins to collect his cards.  First a lead card must be picked; then its idea related partners.  a 3 card set must be completed before a player may start again, picking a lead card first.
3. After all cards have been collected and assembled in 3 card sets, the player with the most card sets wins!

Letter Recognition (for 2-5 players)

Object of the Game
To group by the first letter of the first word on each card, while trying to lay down all cards.  The first player out of cards wins.

Rules:
1. Shuffle cards, one player deals all cards equally to each player.
2. Each player should organize their cards, grouping like letters.  Example: Post Office, Park, Picnic Table, etc.
3. The dealer starts play by laying down the first card.  Play continues clockwise with each child laying down a card that begins with the same letter as led by the dealer.
4. If a player cannot play a card he "passes," and play continues to the next player.
5. If all players have laid down all cards beginning with that same letter, the last player to lay down starts the next group.
6. Play continues and the first player to lay down all his carsd wins!

Recommended for Ages 4 - 8.

Name: Port Dover
Description:
From the rules:

Once, the small village of Port Dover, situated on the north shore of Lake Erie, harboured the world's largest fresh water fishing fleet.  Now, become one of the local captains deploying fishing tugboats and vying for the precious freshwater fish.

Essentially, a set collecting / stock manipulation game, players collect "fish" or cubes in 5 different colors.  To collect fish, you send out your boats to one of five ponds.  Usually, when you dispatch a boat to a pond, you change a fishes vaule and move a fish to a different pond.  After three rounds, players score for the value of any fish type for which they have the majority.

Very fast playing, published and distributed for free at Great Lakes Games III.

Name: Dumb Luck the Ultimate Gambling Party Game
Description:
Dumb Luck is the Ultimate Gambling Party game, which combines poker, blackjack, hi-lo, and 19 other exciting games of chance with a race to the finish line where the winner cleans out what is left in the bank.

The Dumb Luck game is even set up as a "$20 buy in" if playing for some friendly cash is desired (and allowed). Among the many pieces included are 300 11.5 gram poker chips, 3 decks of cards, 8 dice, custom spinner, full color hinged board, and a beautiful locking carrying case.  Take a look at www.dumbluckgame.com

Name: Musical Bingo
Description:
Each player gets a musical bingo card.  The cards consist of a diamond of whole, half, quarter, eighth, and sixteenth notes distributed across the two musical clefs (treble and bass).  Each card either has notes on the lines or notes on the spaces between the lines.  The placement of the high/low notes are staggered and each card has a different placement of the various note lengths.

The caller selects one of the musical note chits, which have a particular pitch and duration.  Players check their boards to see if they can match that pitch and duration.  If they can, they place a marker on the appropriate note.  Play continues until someone can make a run of 5 notes.

Name: Metropolitan Washington Trivia
Description:
This Trivial Pursuit clone has cards with six categories: People, Politics, Places, Culture/Entertainment, Fine Points, and Sports.  The questions relate to the Washington D.C. area.

The included instructions have players take turns rolling a die (not included) and answering a question in the corresponding category.  Answering two questions correctly in a row gives the player one "letter" marker (a piece of cut-out paper).  Once you have gotten 10 letter markers (spelling WASHINGTON) you win.

The rules also state that the cards "can be used with other trivia game boards - just use our colors instead of theirs."

Name: The Game of States and Cities
Description:
The cards in this game contain a map side and a question side.  The map side contains a map of the United States with a state blackened in.  The question side has the name of a state and 6 questions about the state (state flowers, topographical features, capitals etc.).

There are two games to play.  The first involves players looking at the map sides of the cards and making guesses as to which state is blackened in.  If they are correct they score the card.  If they are wrong it goes to the bottom of their card stack.  The second game involves players asking the trivia questions and the other players answering (each player gets one guess and the the players are asked in order around the table).  If you answer correctly you get the card.  If no one answers a question you ask, you get that card.  Most cards win.

The game is covered by U.S. patent 1745946.

Name: La sombra del aguila
Description:
La sombra del Aguila (Shadow of the Eagle) rules are a consolidation of the game system that appeared in Alea Magazine issue 16. With a basic rules and advanced rules.

It includes three scenarios: 

    Alcañiz 1809, 
    Maria 1809 
    Castalla 1813.
Families: Series: The Shadow of the Eagle

Name: Lomby Zombie
Description:
A tile-based, tactical, roleplaying game with a touch of humor. Players fight their way to clear out and secure a house from an ever increasing horde of zombies.

A zombie master creates a house using sets of tiles that players explore. Players allocate statistics to create a character for their play style.

Each round, a new event occurs that affects an aspect of the game is played.

Name: Hearts Card Game
Description: This game comes with a special 44-card deck with pictures of animals.  Players try to avoid taking raccoon cards which are negative points.  Play is faster than Hearts since the deck is smaller.  The scoring and play rules are also simplified for children.

Name: Dr. Kildare
Description:
Medical game for kids Ages 7 - 12.  Based on the TV show of the same name.  Players make rounds in the hospital diagnosing patients.

Contents include:  game board, four pawns, spinner, "analyzer", 12 red doctor cards, 40 blue/green doctor cards, 40 diagnosis cards, and instructions.

Name: The Game of Yertle
Description:
A balancing game of skill based on the popular book by Dr. Seuss.  Based on their spin, players must place Yertles on a balanced plate without causing them to all fall down!

Contents includes: Tumbler, spinner, 21 Yertles.  (Instructions came printed inside the box top.)

Name: Would You Believe?
Description:
Contents:  Six pawns, score card, answer cards, question cards, and the instructions.

Object:  Move up and back down the score card by the use of the move values on the question cards.  Be the first to arrive back at start.

Name: Operation: Sealion 1940
Description:
From the web-site description:
"It is the year 1940. France has surrendered. The British and the remains of the French Army have retreated across the English Channel. Germany now controls the whole of Western Europe. The United Kingdom stands alone, waiting for the Germans to strike. Hitler approves plans for an upcoming invasion of the United Kingdom. A plan called Operation: SEALION. The invasion of the United Kingdom is about to begin!"

This follows in the same vein as some other 'Battle' GAME based upon the "Axis & Allies" series, while you'll need to procure the necessary 'bits' from one of those to play this. There are entirely NEW components made up for this, with "Order of Battle" charts, the 'Gamemap', and with '3' SETs(or 'kinds') of CARDs for use in it.

Name: Powerplay: The Game of Knowledge and Strategy
Description:
POWERPLAY is a question and answer game of political and social issues.  The questions are based on 5 categories (committees): War, Environment, Commerce, State (International politics and policies), and Domestic Policy (U.S. policies and public opinions).  There is a range difficulty from "lots of people know this" to "Wow!  I didn't know that."  More difficult questions have multiple choice answers and higher point (vote) value.  Using political reasoning and/or logic can yield a correct answer even when it is not initially known.
The board for POWERPLAY resembles a Senate chamber.  Players are "Senators".  Each player/team gets a "Committee Table".  The object of the game is to correctly answer questions in each category to gain "Committee Seats" as well as more votes than your opponents.  
Strategies that can be used include:

    answering multiple choice questions correctly before the answers are read gives the player double the votes for that question
    censuring an opponent sends them to the censure room where they cannot answer questions to gain Committee Seats or votes
    filibustering allows a player to remove votes from their opponents
    players can remove opponents from Committees on which they have already gained a seat
    players that have a Seat on every Committee have a choice: either allow their opponents to chose the category for the next question and automatically win with a correct answer or continue playing and maintaining control over which category questions will be answered.


POWERPLAY game pieces are made of wood.

Name: Geo-Graphy
Description:
Object:  To peg-in as many places beginning with the letter indicated by the alphabet dial as the timer allows.

Components:  Peg map board of the world, sand timer, alphabet dial, pegs, and instructions (printed inside box top).

Name: Howdy Doody's TV Game
Description:
A visit to Howdy's own TV studio!  Players spin the "Howdy Doody Time" spinner then move their pieces through the studio visiting the show's characters and scenes.

Components:  Game board, spinner, 6 character pawns (color cardboard stand-ups of show characters), 6 wooden pawn stands, 4 wooden movers.

Name: Silly Sidney
Description:
The absent-minded elephant game.  Based on the Silly Sidney character from the Hector Heathcote Show.  Players travel through the jungle to find their animal friends.

Contents:  14 cards, 4 pawns, game board, spinner, instructions.

Name: Fourcast
Description:
Four games of destiny:  Taro reading, astrological casting, questions oracle, and numberology chart.  Explore your past, present, and future.  Fourcast combines four of the most respected occult methods of divination and fortune telling with games of skill and chance for your amusement and instruction.

Contents:  42 taro cards, six special instruction cards, astrology tally pad, numberology chart pad, fortune formula pad, oracle pendulum, answer board, and the instructions.

Name: Las Dunas 1658
Description:
Game found in Alea Magazine #25. Uses Thirty Year War Quad rules to simulate the battles of Las Dunas (Spanish Tercios against a Franco-English army).

Expands

    Thirty Years War

Name: Montjuic 1641
Description:
Game found in Alea Magazine #25 along with Las Dunas 1658. Uses the Thirty Years War Quad rules to simulate the battle fought out near Montjuich castle in Barcelona pitting the Spanish Tercios against a Catalan Rebel force supported by some French units.

Expands

    Thirty Years War

Name: The Flintstones Stoneage Game
Description:
The game that rocked Bedrock!  Players search Bedrock and collect sets of cards with characters, locations, or objects (Fred's Car) from the show.

Includes game board, 4 scoring pegs, game cards, and instructions.

Name: Scroll
Description:
The board is 11 spaces square. The outer squares are not used except for the corner ‘home base’ squares.  In the center is a 3 square x 3 square scroll zone, which includes four 'sleeping men'.  Each player starts with nine counters.  These may be moved either 1 or 4 squares each turn in a straight line in any direction but may not jump over any other pieces.  Pieces are captured if they are sandwiched between two pieces of one other player of if the piece becomes the third piece in a diagonal formation.  Captured pieces entitle a player to reclaim pieces previously lost.

There are three levels of winning.  Basic - by eliminating all of your opponent's pieces.  A scroll win - make the scroll zone entirely your color.  A Grand scroll - make the scroll zone entirely your color, but without using your sleeping man.

Name: Bible Tit Tat Toe
Description:
Stimulating, entertaining, and educational with 1,000 questions and answers in regular and advanced format.  Players answer questions about the Bible to win squares on the "Tit Tat Toe" board.

Contents:  Tit Tat Toe board, 10 playing squares, 500 question cards, instructions.

Name: Off To See The Wizard
Description:
Children scaled board game where children stand in as pawns.

Each player takes his place ate the beginning of his path, He must always move forward the number of steps indicated by the spinner, following the Yellow Brick Road. Obey the signs on each brick. If a a player is in another player's way, you cannot pass him. If a player has been instructed, though, to go to a space already occupied, the more than one player can occupy the space together. The first player to land on the Gate to Oz must spin a number one to enter and win.

Name: The Battle of Bentonville
Description:
The Battle of Bentonville: Johnston's Last Stand is a grand-tactical simulation of the Battle of Bentonville, which was fought in eastern North Carolina on 19-21 March 1865.

A self published wargame developed in the late 1970's and published in 1980. Designed by Eric D. France, developed by Michael Scott and printed by Dixie Press in Gulfport, MS. This was a limited edition, only a thousand copies, depicting the last large land battle of the American Civil War.

The Battle of Bentonville has large, oversized counters for the introductory game. There is a roster sheet for both the Union and Confederate armies. There is also a roll up hex based board that is flexible (much like the portable chess boards used in tournaments.

There are both introductory and advanced rules, as well as smaller,traditional sized counters for the advanced version. A historical commentary booklet is also included.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2 hours 
Hex: 200 yards / 183 meters 
Units: Brigade

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 29" five color mapsheet
Two single-side printed countersheets (240 1/2" & 120 3/4" counters)
One 16-page Battle of Bentonville rulebook
One 20-page Battle of Bentonville historical commentary folder
One Unit Effectiveness record keeping pad
One 6-sided dice

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-10 hours

Name: Whoops!
Description:
Everybody plays on every spin!  Spin the spinner, do the stunt, squeak the squeaker, tag out, and win!

Contents:  Game board, spinner, squeaker, scoring pegs, scoreboard.

Name: Bicycle Official Rules of Card Games
Description:
Rules for over 250 card games, including numerous Poker variants. Includes other classics such as Spades, Hearts, Bridge, Bid Whist, Pinochle, Rummy, Canasta, Solitaire, Cribbage, childrens card games, "and many more!" Includes a 17 page glossary of card game terms. Illustrated.

90th edition printed in 2003. 338 pages. $7.99 cover price.

This is the new version of Official Rules of Card Games.  This title includes the "Bicycle" name in the header.  "Bicycle" cards are produced by the The United States Playing Card Company, which publishes both this book and its predecessor Official Rules of Card Games.  This new book also has a new editor Joli Quentin Kansil.

Name: Tagina 552 d.c.
Description: The battle of Taginae (552) between Goths and Byzantine during Byzantine reconquest of the Italian Peninsula.

Name: Duellen
Description:
One player is black, the other white. The board is has 7x15 squares. Each player has 17 pieces with values from 1 to 6 in addition to a heart piece, which has a value of 1. Each piece can move diagonally or orthogonally up to the number on it. A piece can take an opponents piece by moving exactly as far as the number on it. One can place two pieces on top of each other, the double piece can then move a distance equal to the sum. A player wins when the opponents heart piece is captured or pieces with a total of 40 or more is captured.

(Translated from the box - in Norwegian)
Duell
Suggested age: 9 years
Production number: 15628

Duell is fought out between two duelists on 105 squares that marks the battlefield. Each player have 18 pieces, of which one is the heart piece. The one who hits the opponents heart piece or knocks out a combined value of 40 of the opponents pieces, wins the game.

Contents:
Game board
2 x 18 pieces
Game rules

Name: Funny Finger
Description:
Funny Fingers everywhere, sticking out here and there!  Match each finger one by one, Funny Finger is funny fun!

Players match up other players' fingers (sticking through holes in the finger fence).

Contents:  Four finger fences, scoreboard, scoring pegs, instructions (inside lid).

Name: Solferino 24 Giugno 1859
Description:
Big game over the battle of Solferino. 
Battalion/squadron level, 1700 counters, two maps, 9 game tables, rules and scenarios folders.
Linking with San Martino 24 Giugno 1859

Name: San Martino 24 Giugno 1859
Description:
A game over the battle of San Martino. 
Battalion/squadron level, 500 counters, one map, 9 game tables, rules and scenarios folders.
Linking with Solferino 24 Giugno 1859

Name: Naughty Dogs
Description:
"As the clothes go out to dry in the sun, naughty dogs steal them... just for fun!"

Naughty Dogs is a children's game for two to four players, ages four and up. The game consists of a clockwork powered clothes line that rotates and four dogs that leap up when a paddle is pressed (or hit). The four colors are red, blue, green and yellow.

To set up, you attach 12 articles of clothing to the washing line, three of each color of pants, shirt and socks (in increasing order of difficulty), wind up the mechanism and let it go. The clothes line spins and the players hit the paddles to make their dog leap up to grab the clothing.

The winner of the game is the person the highest score. you get 10 points for pants, 15 for the tee-shirt and 20 for the socks in your color. Each article of clothing your dog gets that isn't in your color costs you 30 points, so it pays to be a bit careful.

A warning to parents... This is quite a noisy game to play, but each game only lasts for about two minutes.

Name: Think: Logik Trainer
Description:
This is one of the the Ravensburger "Think" games, a brainteaser/mental exercise game-series.
These games are good for mental training, e.g. in creativity, concentration, imagination, logic and so on.

Name: Think: Traveller's
Description:
This is one of the the Ravensburger "Think" games, a brainteaser/mental exercise game-series.
These games are good for mental training, e.g. in creativity, concentration, imagination, logic and so on.

Name: Scaredy Cat
Description:
"Piece together the scarecrow, collect and count the birds but watch out for the scaredy cat."

Scaredy Cat is a children's game for two to six players Ages 5 - 10. The object of the game is to collect cards with birds on them. the winner is the player who has the most birds when the game ends.

To set up the game, all the cards are shuffled together and placed face down on the table. Players take it in turns to draw a card

There are three types of cards in the deck:

Most of the cards in the deck are Bird cards which have a picture of one to six birds on them. When a Bird card is drawn, the player puts it on the table in front of them.

Scaredy Cat cards have a picture of a cat on them. When one of the three scaredy cat cards are drawn, the player who drew it loses all of their bird cards. The bird cards are shuffled back into the deck along with the scaredy cat card.

The six Scarecrow cards each have a different part of a picture of a scarecrow on them. When one is drawn, it is placed in the middle of the table. When all six pieces are on the table, and the scarecrow is complete, the game ends and the birds are counted.

At the end of the game the birds on all the bird cards on the table are counted, the player with the most birds wins.

We have found that the game works best with three or more players. Two player games tend to go on for a long time with much frustration.

Name: The Wonderful Wizard Of Oz Spinner Game
Description:
The Wonderful Wizard Of Oz Spinner Game, 1975 from The Toy Factory.

Simple spinner game for Ages 5 - 12. The spinner is integrated to the middle of the gameboard.

Spin and move the indicated number of spaces. Follow directions there, if any. The first player to reach the Emerald City wins.

Includes 4 character cardboard pawns on stands.

Name: Think: Memo Story
Description:
This is one of the the Ravensburger "Think" games, a brainteaser/mental exercise game-series.
These games are good for mental training, e.g. in creativity, concentration, imagination, logic and so on.

Name: Spin 'n Win
Description:
To be the first player to fill the five slots on his color section of the playing board.

Contents:  Game board with attached spinner, letter cards, instructions (inside box lid).

Name: Limbo Legs
Description: Be nimble, be quick, jump over the limbo stick!  The game is an elimination contest.  Players jump over the revolving limbo stick while performing a task (determined by spinning the large Twister-esque spinner).  If any player fails to clear the limbo stick, they are eliminated from the game.

Name: The Life of Christ: A Christian Bible Game
Description:
From the box: 
"Children and adults will love learning about the life of Jesus Christ through this beautifully illustrated and exciting board game. This inspired board game is framed in the Bible's chronological, geographic and historical context, and features multiple-choice questions about the birth, life, death and resurrection of Jesus Christ."

If players answer a multiple-choice question correctly, they may advance their token one space on the game board.  The player to reach the end of the board first wins.

Name: Speller Junior
Description:
Description from publisher:

A word spelling game.
A beautifully illustrate, multi colored board game, scientifically made to help children learn spellings of 560 carefully selected words which make up a 2/3 of the vocabulary of everyday usage.
Players compete in this exciting game to spell the words correctly and race along the path on the board to score the maximum marks.

An enjoyable and challenging game that would go a long way to test, correct and reinforce the knowledge of spellings of a child. He/she would be able to learn the spelling of 560 selected basic words which are commonly misspelled.

Name: Plic-Plac Pirates
Description:
A plic-plac is a couple of cards which have the same pattern or the same color. This makes combinations in several ways.
Players have to locate and pocket the maximum of plic-plac.
Other players can react by cutting plic-placs. If a player fails to do a plic-plac, then he gives information to other players and makes its plic-plac vulnerable.

Name: Termitenspiel
Description: 64 (4 sets of 16) small cardboard cubes with termite trails, all in a canvas bag. Rules for 6 games are included.

Name: On to Berlin
Description: An LPS bonus mini-game, On To Berlin is a 2-player game tactical / operational simulation of the hypothetical last battle of WW2, code-named Operation Eclipse.  This is a variant of Fortress Berlin that assumes the Allies launched an airborne assault (3 US and 3 British divisions) on Berlin in March 1945.  On To Berlin is not a complete game by itself as it requires ownership of Fortress Berlin.

Name: Chariots
Description: This is a game for a standard piecepack about racing chariots, like in the Circus Maximus in ancient Rome. The game uses a plotted impulse based movement system similar to that in the game Star Fleet Battles or Car Wars. This game is about racing, not combat.

Name: RIFF: The Music Trivia DVD Game
Description:
A smart DVD trivia game for music fans.  Very creative ways of presenting the questions.  Great to play with a bunch of friends.  There's a game called Battle of the Bands which pits the two teams against each other head to head.

All the questions were new, nothing repeated unlike some other DVD games, and it was really easy to play.

Name: Domina
Description:
Domina is a traversal game by noted New Zealand game and puzzle designer Karl Scherer. The object is to get one of your pieces to the opposite end of the board before your opponent does the same.

The board is an 8x8 square grid, and the pieces are rectangles in two colors, seven for each player, each spanning two square spaces. Dominos in two colors on a standard Checker board work well. On a turn, a player pins one end of any of his/her pieces, then rotates it 90° clockwise. If, and only if, that would cause the rotating end of the piece to occupy a space that is either already filled, off the board or behind the pivot end of the piece, continue rotating the piece another 90° to 180°. Likewise, continue rotating another 90° to 270° if the next target space is unavailable or illegal. If none of the three target spaces make a legal move, the player must select a different piece to move. The first to land one end of a piece on the opposite row wins.

Name: Ohne Worte!
Description: Players try to form words by playing a letter-card and using (at least) all the letters already on the table and the one just played. If anybody fails he has to take all the cards played so far and he starts a new word. After all cards have been played the player with the least cards taken wins.

Name: DVD Sudoku
Description:
This version of Sudoku comes with a DVD. The tiles are double-sided: one side has traditional numbers, the other side has symbols for slightly different experience.

Place the board in the middle of the table. The board shows an empty Sudoku puzzle. In the box there are the numbered tiles.

Start the DVD an choose from the menu which variant you want to play.
In the classic mode, the screen shows the startposition. Or you can choose a variant where only the numbers 1 to 9 are placed once.
When it's your turn, push 'enter' on the remote control, place a tile, and push 'menu'. The other players can comment your placement. If the active player placed a tile on the wrong place, he/she gets penalty time. The turn is moved to the next player.

When a puzzle is solved (or cannot be solved any futher) choose çup' from the menu. All the players can see what their time is. The fastest player wins the game.

The other side of the tiles can be used to play with different colors instead of numbers. There are also chips included. When the timer reaches 30 minutes, it starts over from zero. To remind the players that half a hour is passed they can use the chips.

Name: Hexade
Description:
This game is played with the same set of Havannah (another game by Christian Freeling): an hexagonal board (size 8) and two sets of stones.

Players take turns placing a stone of their color on the board.
Goal of the game is forming "a perfect six", which means creating:

     six stones in a straight row, or 
     six stones in a compact triangle, or 
     six stones in a small hexagon.


Captures are possible: you can capture two adjacent opponent's stones sandwiching them between two of your stones.

Online Play


     Gamerz (turn-based, play by email or play by web)

Name: Pindoo
Description:
An abstract strategy board game for 2 to 6 players.
Taking turns and using dice, players must move their Pindoos (pieces) to the opposite side of the board before the opponent(s).

Name: Terrytoons Mighty Mouse Game
Description:
Thirteen cards are placed on designated areas on the game board’s track. Each player, in turn, rolls the die and moves one’s pawn along the track. Whenever a player’s pawn lands on a card, the player takes the card. Most cards have a value of 1, 2, 3 or 4. The object of the game is to collect cards totaling twelve. Cards that have a drawing of Mighty Mouse, of which there are eight, allow a player to move backwards.

This is seemingly a different game from Mighty Mouse Game

Name: Captain Gallant of the Foreign Legion
Description:
This antique game is based on the TV show Captain Gallant of the Foreign Legion.  The TV show featured the well-known LARRY "BUSTER" CRABBE, who played Captain Michael Gallant.  He is better known for his roles as TARZAN, FLASH GORDON and BUCK RODGERS

Players are legionnaires (starting in the center of the board)  or  North Africans (starting from the outer ring of the board).  Each race to make it to the other side.  The first player to move all his tokens to the other side, wins.

Name: Satellite Shoot
Description:
This game has the same mechanics as the classic Battleship game, but it's the "Space Travel" version.

The board is separated by a cardboard stand-up divider, and the cardboard spaceship counters are placed on the board in the same way as Battleship.

Some very nice retro 60's artwork on the cover and board divider.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: China / South America
Description:
This Age of Steam Expansion expands the game to China and South America.

Steam Brothers started to design expansions mainly for fun and adding re-playability to this great game. Now, with the help of John Bohrer from Winsome Games, we can share our pleasure with all the Age of Steam fans.

With this expansion, you’ll experience new great action such as Diplomatic Pressure in China and El Presidente for the South America.

Halfway reimplemented by:

    Age of Steam Expansion: South America / South Africa

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: North Eastern USA / South Africa
Description:
This Age of Steam Expansion expands the game to South Africa and Northeastern USA. Steam Brothers strikes again with two other maps for the great Age of Steam. Now, you can exploit the awesome resources of South Africa just like the golden age of Klondike and speculate in the Northeastern USA.

Halfway reimplemented by:

    Age of Steam Expansion: South America / South Africa

Name: The Wild-Flower Game
Description:
From the box:
This game was developed to help you get to know and recognize some of the wild flowers that can be seen in Britain during the Spring and Summer.  It should also make you aware that the future of even some quite familiar plants is now anything but secure in the wild.

Game Synopsis:
Roll the die and move along a numbered circular track.  Gain points for landing on a colored circle; double them if you identify the associated wild flower.  There are 'chance' cards, giving you extra points for answering wild-flower based questions.

Name: Innamoramento e Amore
Description:
A game from Francesco Alberoni's Book.
This game explores human interaction from falling in love to marriage and betrayal..

Name: lamafia
Description:
This game design project has been abandoned in 2007.

Sicily, 1943. Main Mafia families in Western Sicily, supported by the Allies who have overthrown Fascism, took back the control of rural areas inside the country.

Up to 6 powerful Mafia families struggle to achieve the economical and political power in Sicily and Italy, managing their deals with the Italian-American gangsters and with the South American and Far East drug traffickers.
They accumulate their fortunes through the typical ways of organized crime, then re-invest their revenues in money laundering, in order to get some affiliates among the entrepreneurs and politicians.
The aim is to increase their prestige inside the organized crime structure, killing their opponents and dealing with the reaction of the State, always adapting their income sources to the evolution of the political context, through the enitre 50 years of Italian history depicted by the game.

Name: Baseball
Description:
Baseball - a Parker Brothers game - has some unusual components for its age.  (There are three copyright dates; 1949 on the cards, 1950 on the rules and 1959 on the box.)  There is a 3D score board plus a simple mechanism to compare the batter and pitcher's play choices.  The results vary according to the plays and the rules cover Strikes, Walks, Outs, Runs and Stealing.

A deck of special cards cover certain situations.

This game is about out-guessing your opponents!

Name: Quizmo Phonetic
Description: A bingo type game that can be used to help teach phonetics and reading.

Name: Divine Power
Description:
Who will be the first Archangel to take seat on God´s right hand or Arch-demon to sit down beside Satan?
You are a divine being with the free will to serve God or Satan. You are leading your minions of demons or angels on an ancient map from biblical times. Allie your self with players of the same faith or cross over to the other side and stab them in the back. Become the mightiest Archangel/demon and rule the world together with your Master.

Name: Long Shot
Description: Your Don has no idea about horse racing, but he owns a horse. It´s your task to bring it in first. If you fail you have another option to make some money: Betting on the other horses and make a lot of money.

Name: Twisted Tales
Description:
Created by a 7 year-old girl (now she would be 16!; is this the start to a game designer's resume?), this is a story telling game where you take familiar characters and twist the stories, so Handel and Gretel blew the pigs straw house down.  The game consists of character and story cards.

Suitable for Ages 4 and up.

Name: Falling into a Black Hole: A Space VLBI Intergalactic Adventure
Description:
From NASA's site for kids:

you can take an imaginary trip to a black hole right now!

You will also visit such interesting places as a giant array of radio telescopes in the New Mexico desert and NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California. Then you will blast into space and visit the Earth-orbiting Japanese VSOP Radio Telescope (launched in 1997) and Russia's RadioAstron telescope (not yet launched).

Then you will leave Earth orbit and go on to explore other galaxies, an interstellar gas cloud, a neutron star, and finally, a black hole! You will earn "Antigravity Tokens" along the way, so that you will be able to escape from the black hole's tremendous gravitational force.

Object of the game:

Be the first to reach the Black Hole armed with at least 25 Antigravity Tokens so that you will be able to get yourself out and go home after you are through exploring.

Game available at - http://spaceplace.nasa.gov/en/kids/svlbi_do1.shtml

Name: Itsy Bitsy Spider Game
Description:
"The exciting game of Itsy Bitsy Spider's adventure!"

Itsy Bitsy Spider Game is a children's game for two to four players Ages 4 and up.

The main board of the game is a spiderweb angled at 45 degrees with a tap (faucet) at the top which, when turned, releases a small blue ball. Playing pieces are small spiders which slot into the board. Movement is determined by a twister-style spinner.

To begin, each player takes one of the spiders and, in turn, spins the spinner. The player may spin up:
- 2,3,4 or 5: the spider moves that number of spaces up the board; 
- "switch spiders": the player may change places with another spider higher up on the board; or
- "turn the tap": the player turns the tap at the top of the spiderweb, releasing one of the blue balls.

The objective of the game is to move your spider up the spiderweb to the top. During the game, the tap may be turned, the ball released has a fairly good chance of hitting some of the spider playing pieces and knocking them off the spiderweb. Spiders which are knocked off have to start again at the bottom. The winner is the first player to reach the top.

Name: Smarte Penger
Description: The players try to get control in actual Norwegian companies. Most of the shares in the companies are sold in open or sealed auctions.

Name: Die Siedler von Catan: Atlantis – Szenarien & Varianten
Description:
A boxed expansion for Die Siedler von Catan (The Settlers of Catan) which collects and revises previously released small expansions and adds a few new ones. It was bundled free with the 10th anniversary gold box version of Settlers.

The expansions are: 

    Atlantis
    Catan: Event Cards (Events on Catan) 
    Im Dschungel (The Jungle), 
    Vulkane auf Catan (Volcano on Catan) 
    Die Spezialisten (The Specialists)
    Die Stadtmauern (The City Walls)
    Burgen auf Catan (Castles on Catan)
    Der Grosse Fluss (The Great River), 
    Der Hafenmeister (The Harbourmaster)
    Die Magische 7 (The Magic 7)


Belongs to the Catan Series.

Expands:

    Die Siedler von Catan  (The Settlers of Catan)

Name: Strat-O-Sphere
Description:
David Royffe's first game, which later evolved into his Pylos.

With four players, each player has 23 spheres (marbles).  The spheres are used to build a pyramid layer by layer on a central grid.  In rotation, each player adds a sphere to form a chain of their color.  When a layer is complete the next player starts a new chain on the next layer up.  Each sphere is now supported by four spheres below, one or more of which must be of the same color.  If a player is blocked they must fill all the empty places in that layer.  However there is an option to sacrifice a sphere into the tomb.  The player who places the final sphere at the top of the pyramid wins.

There is a puzzle version for one.  With two players, each player plays with 46 spheres in two colors.

Name: Lauras Sternenspiel
Description:
"O my dear, what a mess!", mother burst out while clapping her hands over her head. She has just entered the children's room. Laura and her younger brother Tommy have been playing all day and their toys are scattered across the little room. They must tidy the room before they go to bed, but it is already beginning to get dark. Will the children be able to finish and be in bed before Laura's star is twinkling in the sky?

Laura's Star Game is about playing - hearing - feeling - reading!

The 12 Displays form the entire room of Laura's as a 6×2 picture. Each display has two empty slots for a couple of almost identical items like cars, airplanes, hand mirrors, flashlights, rubber ducks and slippers.

These items are placed inside a bag that has two separate pockets, and each pocket will contain one of each item plus either the dog or the bear. The 7 pieces of the Sun is assembled to form a clever timer: it has a central star-shaped part plus 5 pieces, each with 3 beams filling out the slots between the arms of the star. Finally is a cloud piece covering the sun when the game begins.

A player will stick a hand into each pocket of the bag, trying to identify two identical shapes without looking. This is much harder than it seems since the pieces have nicely rounded edges that makes them feel somewhat like each other, and even adults will find it difficult. It is however good training of the motor skills - especially for the wrong hand!

When the player is confident that two identical pieces have been found are the two pieces simultaneously retracted: If identical have the player succeed and the pieces are placed in the corresponding display and placed in front of the player.

Should the two pieces turn out not to be identical are they returned to the same pockets they were drawn from, and a piece of the Sun puzzle is removed. When only the central part of the sun remains will it be flipped over the next time a player fails, thus showing the star of the story. It's bedtime, the game is over and all the players lost because they didn't make the room tidy in time.

If the players manage to make the room in time, that is when the only tiles left in the bag are the dog and the bear, will the winner the player with most displays in front of her.

Name: Tactica: Medieval Rulebook
Description:
Tactica Medieval is, not surprisingly, an adaptation of the Tactica: An Historical Approach to Ancient Wargaming ancients period rules set to the medieval period.  There are three games included in the book:  an army game, a siege game (involving boiling oil, siege engines, siege towers, etc.) and a campaign system.

Army lists for the major armies from about 1000-1500AD are included.

Name: Möhren mopsen
Description:
Small cards are laid out face down on the table picturing either a Rabbit (always face down) or a Fox (initially face up) , Foxes in a circle, Rabbits inside that circle.
Play :
- If a player is sure to uncover a Rabbit, he can do so and earn a Carrot if he´s right. In that case he also takes a Fox card, turns it face down and replaces the Rabbit card (which is discarded) with it. 
- Otherwise, he can throw the dice. According to the result of the dice he gets a Carrot (for free), or has to pick either a Fox or a Rabbit from the face down cards, which earns him a Carrot if he gets it right.

Player with most Carrots wins.

Alternate names : "Carrot Catching", "Lapins et Renards"

Name: Battle to Baghdad
Description:
From the Jiggi Games website:

"The US invasion of Iraq is now being played out all around the world. Jiggi Games has incorporated the events of the Iraq war into a reality board game.
Each player commands 3000 troops as you battle your way through Iraq. You will take out airports, night bomb cities, hunt down Saddam Hussein, and take over Baghdad...but look out!
This game is full of rebel attacks, car bombers, snipers, and other sorts of danger."

Name: Cagola
Description:
The Players balance cargo on a bamboo ship.  If you tip over the ship, you're out.

From the box quoted exactly:
Let's go sailing on this sunny day! Load up the picnic baskets and all which is needed for a lovely day on the water.  But keep an eye on the loading, because the sea water keeps the boat unstable. Balancing fun on wild waters!

Contents: 1 sailing boat with flag, 36 bamboo cargo items in 3 different shapes 1 dice (sic). For 2-6 players. From 4 years of age.  100% natural bamboo.

Name: Morocco
Description:
In Morocco, players become merchants in the open-air Moroccan market, trading their wares in an attempt to drum up interest, selling them when profitable and storing them in their warehouses in hopes of future gains.  Keeping a shrewd eye on what their fellow merchants are up to and a keen sense of timing will make you the richest merchant in Morocco!

Morocco is an economic card game for 3-5 players.

Name: Pull The Rug Out
Description:
A variety of plastic objects (ten are supplied) are balanced on top of each other on a special 'rug', the order of which is determined randomly by a spinner.  At any time after playing a minimum of two objects, a player may elect to "pull the rug out" from beneath their structure.  If any objects fall no points are scored; if no objects fall one point is awarded for each object used.

The first player to twenty points wins the game.

Name: Slim River
Description:
On January 7, the British 12th Brigade, which had been hammered back for weeks, now faced a new bold foe: Japanese tanks (type 95 and 97) composed of two companies supported by the 42nd Regiment. With only a few antitank weapons, the British defenders were hard pressed when the Japanese bold use of armor in the jungles began at 0330. What followed was simply a mini-blitzkrieg as the Japanese tanks found numerous previously undiscovered roads through which to bypass British defenses. The British really did not know what hit them and by 0830, the Japanese had secured the Slim River bridge and the road to Singapore was open. In the game, chance cards create the uncertainty of battle from the sudden approach of Japanese aircraft, discovering a bypass road, stumbling onto a minefield, or the sudden activation of British units. Formation cards determine which formations activate and in which order, depending on the player that plays them. This will vary with every game turn. All this creates a totally unpredictable game.

The game comes with a 11x17 in. map, 280 counters, formation and chance cards, which are used to activate the counters on the map, a rulebook. The scale is 350 yards per hex, platoons, individual tanks\weapons, 30 min. turns for a total of 11 turns.

Name: Arkham Horror: Dunwich Horror Expansion
Description:
Dunwich Horror is a large-box expansion for the Fantasy Flight Games edition of Arkham Horror, and is a part of the Arkham Horror Series.

Once again, terror has come to New England, this time spreading to the small country town of Dunwich, just a few miles from Arkham. The area is filled with rolling hills, many of which are topped with mysterious stone circles or the ramshackle houses of the recluses who live outside of town. At night, the piping of the whippoorwills fills the air, while lightning bugs dance in the witch-haunted hallows. This is a place where dark pacts with unknown forces are made, and where city folk go to disappear without a trace. But however much the people of Dunwich may distrust outsiders, they desperately need your help against the Horror that has manifested on the Whateley farm...

Dunwich Horror adds 8 new Investigators, 4 new Ancient Ones and many new Investigator cards, Mythos cards and monsters to the base set.  It also adds new location cards, for a total of 14 cards at each location instead of 7. Dunwich Horror also adds many new mechanics. Players can take a train to Dunwich (a new board that is placed on the end of the Arkham board), which adds 9 new locations and 2 new outer worlds to the game. Players reduced to 0 stamina or sanity have the option of drawing from the Injury or Madness deck, acquiring permanent handicaps, rather than losing half their items and clue tokens. Gates are no longer permanently sealed (a popular house rule in the base game). Condition cards provide benefits to all players may be activated. And, of course, the Dunwich Horror itself - not as strong as the Ancient Ones, yet far stronger than any other monster in the game.

This expansion also features revised rules and an FAQ that addresses many of the perceived faults of the base game. Replacement cards are provided for items and spells that are subject to errata.
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Frédéric II: La guerre de Sept Ans
Description:
This game appeared in Vae Victis issue 65.  It covers the first two years of the Seven Years' War (1757-8).  Each turn represents forty days of real time, each counter is a "brigade equivalent."

This issue also includes counters and a scenario for Paris vaut bien une messe (issue 50), covering the battle of Moncontour (1569), and the usual collection of articles and reviews.  As with all VV games, the counters must be assembled prior to play.
